description:
The Google Polling Place Locator project began in 2008, when in cooperation with the Pew Center of the States we developed the Voting Information Project and VIP interchange format. In addition to helping States open up their data we provided the Polling Locator API and embeddable gadgets for organizations and candidates to help their constituents know where to vote, who was on the ballot and how to find out if they were registered.

In 2010 Google is continuing this project, working on helping more states open their data in both VIP and other formats. This talk will give both an overview of the project and in-depth technical description of the API and data sources, specifically addressing:    • How to query the Polling Locator API
   • Where the data comes from
   • How States prepare, submit, and update data in both VIP and other formats
   • How to access the open data for results reporting

Time permitting we’ll also discuss how we’re broadening the scope to international elections, and some of our trials and tribulations along the way.
title: Open Election Information and The Google Polling Place Locator API
